The message can be executed on the executing chain only after a message with the given hash was successfully relayed."}},"notice":"SequencedRelayer is a helper contract that works on top of Optimism interoperability protocol to allow sequencing several executing messages by specifying message dependency for each executing message. The squenced messages are guaranteed to be executed in the correct order. SequencedRelayer can be used to trustlessly pay the relayer for executing cross-chain messages. To work correctly, SequencedRelayer must be deployed with the same address on all supported params._message: Message to trigger the target address with.
params._prevMsgHash: Message hash of the previous message in the sequence that the                     current sequence entry depends on. Can be zero to indicate the first entry in the sequence.

params._chainId: Chain ID of the destination chain.
params._message: Message to trigger the target address with.
params._prevMsgHash: Message hash of the previous message in the sequence that the                     current sequence entry depends on. Can be zero to indicate the first entry in the sequence.

returns.msgHash_: The hash of the message being sent, which can be used for tracking whether                     the message has successfully been relayed.

relaySequenceEntry(address,bytes32,bytes.notice: Relays the message that was sent by other OPSequencedRelayer. Can be successful only after a message with the given hash was successfully relayed before.

sendSequenceEntry(uint256,address,bytes3.notice: Sends a message to some target address on a destination chain. The message can be executed on the executing chain only after a message with the given hash was successfully relayed.
